Tom Green : 1 day ago 
@mathieu there's no battery either. I guess each has their own strengths and weaknesses but it's all going to depend on just how those "colour ANSI" lumens stack up to other companies estimates of ANSI lumens.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 day ago 
Tom, we explained many times how we measure it and other competitors may say they use ANSI but how come 1000 ansi is jot the same on 2 different competitors? So that's why we decided to say that our PicoPix Max is 850 and if you buy another 850 ansi lumens from another competitor, it will be the same.
⤷ Tom Green : 1 day ago 
Oh absolutely, perhaps I didn't articulate what I was saying properly. Since competitors see differences in real world brightness even though they use the same test, I'm interested to see if the Picopix's more rigorous method will mean that real world brightness is competitive with other, supposedly brighter, models.

Does that make more sense?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 day ago 
Hello Tom, what we do is first measure our lumens, then compare it to 5 different brands and product with the exact same supposed ANSI
⤷ Tom Green : 1 day ago 
Sounds very thorough, I'm impressed!

Mathieu jobic : 2 days ago 
For bt 5 and the separated chanel, i got some bad news and great news.
its actually a speaker issue, some speakers are sold as a pair (2 speakers) and actually connect as 1, and can be configured for left and right chanel, sonos seem to be able to do it too, so if you find the right speaker (or if a manufacturer implement it in its next line) that something you will be able to use with the picomax, because the few speakers that i found with those option are old and around bt 2.0 not 5.0
⤷ Mathieu jobic : 2 days ago 
So you loose the range and the bitrate that goes with bt5.0
⤷ Mathieu jobic : 2 days ago 
It also mean that the price is higher than normal because its rare (and old), the one i found are sold close to 200 euro for the pair.

You really want to spend 50 euros or more on a stand that is not usefull at all ? The pico can correct the ratio so you don't have to put the projector at the center of the room, you can actually put it on a shelve next to a wall on the right or left of the room and its fine, it also resolve the issue of cable management you were talking about because even if the stand has that you still have to hide the cable that plug in an outlet so you will have a cable on the floor.
⤷ Mathieu jobic : 2 days ago

8823514
Olivier HUET : 3 days ago 
Hi Philips,

Happy to be a backer of this great project :)

I know it's probably too late, but for your next projector : add an HDMI output :)
It first sound silly for a projector, but it isn't ;)

1) It's a portable smart projector, on which we can install our app and store our films. 
So it would be nice be able to connect to a TV, bigger projector, home cinema... 

2) you could send audio output to hdmi. 
Many home cinema ampli use HDMI for audio input :)
So it supports 5.1, 7.1 etc...
⤷ Olivier HUET : 3 days ago 
Many of my friend don't have good white wall to project something and have old TV not supporting HECV, and some of them are not able to connect USB key... so it would be very cool to use the pico on their old TV with HDMI :)
A micro-HDMI for the HDMI output should be also ok.
⤷ Philips Projection : 3 days ago 
Hello 
1: This is not the use of this projector, unfortunately we cannot support this
2: We are testing ARC for the HDMI but not stable for the moment
3: This is not supposed to replace an Apple TV or Android TV box :-)
Cheers,
⤷ Olivier HUET : 3 days ago 
1 &3) This is not supposed, but it could :) It would be a really great device :-)
First phone was not supposed to take pictures ;-)
⤷ Philips Projection : 3 days ago 
Yes but we need to focus on the most important features. We cannot have ALL features in the world. Otherwise it would cost 3000 euros and non portable :-)

Points of Reference *measured in dBA or decibels

0 The softest sound a person can hear with normal hearing
10 normal breathing
20 whispering at 5 feet
30 soft whisper
50 rainfall
60 normal conversation
110 shouting in ear
120 thunder

Paul Hampson : 5 days ago 
The latest update mentions that you have "zero lag" over Bluetooth. Does that mean you support one of the low-latency codecs? Even latency-targeted codecs like aptX-LL have around 37-40ms of latency, but standard BT codecs (SBC, other aptX flavours) have around 200-300ms latency, which is quite noticeable.

Alternatively, will plugging in an external USB audio adaptor work? I have a Genki Audio adaptor for Nintendo Switch, and I hope I'll be able to use that with this projector if necessary.

We are still testing the USB card, for the moment we just have 2.0. It needs to be special card for Android.

8817541
Vigée Dimitri : 7 days ago 
Bonjour Philips quelle sera donc la résolution d'affichage pour Netflix ?
⤷ Philips Projection : 7 days ago 
Bonjour, avec Widevine L1: Full HD!
⤷ Vigée Dimitri : 7 days ago 
Je ne comprends pas votre réponse alors pourquoi vous dites: 
"Kamran, Youtube is supported in 4K. Only Prime and Netflix is affected. Boxes like Apple TV connected on HDMI are not affected"??
⤷ Philips Projection : 7 days ago 
1: YouTube reçoit en 4k mais le projecteur projette en Full HD
2: Widevine L1  DRM doit être installé pour que l'application Netflix ou Prime qui est dans le projecteur puisse fonctionner en full HD
3: si vous brancher une box telle que Apple TV en hdmi sur le projecteur, la box n'est pas affectée et donc Netflix ou prime fonctionne en full HD
Maintenant nous travaillons pour obtenir le Widevine L1
⤷ Vigée Dimitri : 7 days ago 
Ok donc si je comprends bien, wideline L1 DRM est une application à télécharger et à installer sur le videoprojecteur pour que Netflix, etc sois en full HD ? Merci encore pour votre réactivité.
⤷ Philips Projection : 7 days ago 
Bonjour, non. C'est une certification avec une cle d'acces donnee pas Google.
⤷ Vigée Dimitri : 7 days ago 
Ok merci

8816675
Marco Lammers : 8 days ago 
About the Google mobile services (GMS) certification for Projectors with Android AOSP

At the official Google Issue Tracker, it appears it went up in priority from P4 to P1 !
https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/142580217

P4	= An issue that should be addressed eventually
P1	An issue that needs to be addressed quickly. Such an issue significantly impacts a large percentage of users. The impact of the issue is to a core organizational function, or fundamentally impedes another team.

8811954
lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
@ Floris Weerbrouck
Correct, the zoom is not optical it is only digital. Digital zoom out effectively removes pixels all the way around the image to make it smaller which technically reduces it from 1080p (total number of pixels on screen) to lower than that, but considering it is 1080p, i.e. there are a lot of pixels, you won't notice too much loss in quality. The ideal scenario is to set the zoom to maximum screen size so that it uses every pixel.
8811951
Floris Weerbrouck : 11 days ago 
Perhaps the same question as Adam Wilson down below. Is it correct that there is no optical zoom, only digital? So for each distance from the wall, there is an "ideal" screen size? The digital zoom leads to some quality loss I assume?
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
Hello, yes there is a digital zoom. And there is no loss when going down.
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
We also remind you that this is a portable projector. Only very big home cinema projectors have optical zoom
⤷ Floris Weerbrouck : 11 days ago

8811733
lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
Hi again. A couple of questions:

1. Can you give us an update on the review video? when will it be released?
2. Can you tell me if you have an update on the video sync fix for Bluetooth speakers I mentioned to guarantee all Bluetooth speakers can be in perfect sync

Thank you :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
Hello
1: as previously said: we won't give anymore deadline for news to avoid any issues
2: we will check this later on and keep you posted.
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
OK thank you :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
The BT audio and video will be in sync when playing supported codecs using system APIs, by following standard latency compensation algorithm. But real-time media like games or the whole system cannot be synchronized as doing so will add latency to the whole projector’s display. For users who require low latency audio for real-time applications, Bluetooth is not suitable regardless of the codec used (like aptX). aptX for example only goes as low as 32ms. This is not enough for most music programs
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
Hi, Yes this is why there should be the option for the user to add video latency if they want to. So if you are playing games then you would not use it. But if you watch movies and videos (which will be the most use case for this product) there should be an option to adjust latency in the video. Some bluetooth speakers have internal processing which can increase latency so you would adjust the video latency to ensure the video is in sync with the audio. This is the only way to guarantee sync
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
Otherwise i guarantee there will be people who have sync issues because of the speaker they use when watching videos and it will cause issues. Having the user adjustment (like 5 simple levels of delay in video) is a way to guarantee you can put the video in sync with every bluetooth speaker on the market
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
Luke: how do you do it on your laptop for eg?
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
Well a laptop no one would typically watch a movie with Bluetooth speakers. However on VLC player you can adjust the video delay to sync with your Bluetooth speaker audio. In the instance of this projector the delay should be applied at the display level so that everything can be in sync with the audio. This would mean creating I small delay in what is being shown on screen so it is in sync. A simple 1-5 levels of adjustment would mean all Bluetooth speakers and headphones would be in sync
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
VLC is installed in our projector. In any case, the video sync is too complicated to implement. Just for your reference if you want to delay system wide display by 1 second. 1920x1080 pixels times 3 bytes per pixel (24bit color) times 60 pictures per second (60 FPS refresh). That’s 356 MB of memory required + a nice CPU to process all this. Also the graphic card can’t transcode 1080p 60hz video in real-time. It can decode sure but not encode.
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
Yes I understand VLC is on the system but people will of course use Netflix, amazon, youtube etc. The system wide delay only needs to be maximum 250ms, not 1 second. So 5 levels a user can select, 50, 100, 150 etc. And the delay does not need to be transcoded. Its simply delaying between the process of sending the video from the CPU to the DLP chip. So if you activate a delay it just delays sending the process to the DLP chip by that time.
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
This is also something that Texas Instruments can assist with as they could help with the link between the CPU and the DLP chip in adding a delay. I think this feature would make this projector so much better than all others. If you google bluetooth delay you can see its a wide issue so having it as a selling point on your projector would be huge
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
And where will this video be stored till it’s ready to be sent?
⤷ Philips Projection : 11 days ago 
Again, Netflix or others are auto compensating it.
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
If it needs memory, at the max 250ms latency, only 89MB or RAM would be needed which is a small amount given it has 2GB. But the system should not need to transcode. It is not the video file you ware watching that is transcoded, it is the delay is between the CPU and the DLP chip.
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
So all the processing the CPU does, before it sends it to the DLP chip, it can send to RAM first with the delay then to the DLP chip. This should not need transcoding as it is a simple delay function in the coding and the memory requirement is very small, only max 15 frame delay
⤷ lukesavvides : 11 days ago 
Netflix may also auto compensate, but there are many videos we would watch such as from video files on a USB stick, other video apps like plex, youtube etc.  This I think it why you have not seen a sync issue yet because you are using an app that has auto delay.
8811723

Skanda Shyamsundar : 12 days ago 
@AY, what Indian backers are asking for is very simple. It takes one email to the shipping agency who should gladly oblige. Why is this so difficult. A PDF can easily be made by the shippers, who will give the rates in a single page. Many of the times a large customs duty is levied in cash at the times of delivery. These are common issues here. We just want to be prepared that's all.

Just wanted to say that I love the product idea and campaign as a whole, wish you a lot of success! :-) 

Only thing it’s too bad you aren’t implementing codecs (e.g. AAC/aptx/aptx low latency/aptx HD) to the bluetooth module as it’s a cheap addition and with these you can ensure the wireless audio quality will be as good as with wired quality, presuming the right conditions are satisfied. I’d even be happy to pay extra for this feature. :-)

8810500
Skanda Shyamsundar : 12 days ago 
Again in India, if Phillips is going to use a company like DHL or FEDEX, they will have a very clear and defined process of customs clearance. Not a single high value parcel can enter India without Aadhaar and other info. So these companies will be able to actually exactly tell us what we need to pay. We have no issues paying whatever is due. Just need to know what we are in for, upfront. The reason I'm saying this is that if the papers are not right, we will end up paying IGST of close to 48%!
8810498
Skanda Shyamsundar : 12 days ago 
My dear sirs from countries other than India, the reasons we are asking for what we have to pay is that in India, sometimes the VAT that is charged is not on the shown value of the device but on what the customs assessors think. This is a very valid and fair request. It does not make sense in our "early backing" and paying a much higher end cost. Unlike some of the "requests" that border on nitpicking, what we are asking for is what we have to be ready for financially. What's wrong with that

8808036
Lockhardo Loverdaal : 14 days ago 
Hi!

A How powerful wall charger or powerbank Max will require (charging and using it at the same time)? Can I use something like this Anker charger:

https://www.anker.com/products/variant/PowerPort-Speed-5-Ports/A2054111

Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 14 days ago 
Hello there, there is already a charger inside the box! You can also use the MacBook Pro 15" charger as well
⤷ Lockhardo Loverdaal : 13 days ago 
Hello! I'm trying to find a single solution for the all recharging. I think nowadays it's insane to have seven different chargers if you can manage with only one. Lot of companies are actually selling products without the charger because the fact that we already have one (or seven) at home and the environmental impact.

So I will try again, what is the watt requirement for the charger to be able to charge and use the projector at the same time? Do you think my Anker will do the job?

Thanks!

8806264
lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
Is there a possibility you could offer the projector in an alternative colour/finish, like white? I think it would look really smart in white. Also I don't like the glossy finish because it will pick up scratches and fingerprints very easily. A matte finish also makes it look more premium and more rugged especially as it is a portable projector so will be put in bags
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
Anyone who agrees post a comment so we can show support for that change. If there many people who feel the same then it makes sense to make the plastics change
⤷ Philips Projection : 15 days ago 
Hello, unfortunately we won't change the color nor finish. The PicoPix Max is part of the PicoPix Collection which is black. Premium appealing, colors and finish is really tough to choose and everyone can have a different opinion. We made several survey about the color of our product and that's why we chose this one.
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
OK colour i understand, but all of your other picopix projectors are matte plastic which is much much more resistant to scratches and fingerprints. So the choice of the glossy finish doesn't make much sense because it will be scratched very easily. Don't you agree?
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
Actually your picipix range are all different, some matte, some glossy, some white, some black.
⤷ Philips Projection : 15 days ago 
Hello, not at all, all the PicoPix Nano, Micro and Max have the exact same design language, colors and finish
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
Yes I agree those 3 are the same, but the other picopix products (PicoPix Mobile, PicoPix pocket) are different. I understand the logic of creating a standard design across the range, but given these are portable, they will be put in bags and moved much more often then a normal projector which means they are subject to scratching a fingerprints a lot more. so either the finish should be made more durable, i.e. matte finish, or perhaps release a protective skin for it to protect it.
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
Otherwise if it starts picking up scratches, it makes the Philips branding look bad because other people who see it covered in scratches will be put off buying a philips product because they can see it can be damaged easily.
⤷ Philips Projection : 15 days ago 
Don't worry there is a 3 layers painting + UV
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
That is no indication of the hardness of the finish. It is the hardness that determines the scratch resistance, not the UV
⤷ Philips Projection : 15 days ago 
Luke, that's why we will also develop rubber cover in the future for all our PicoPix.
⤷ lukesavvides : 15 days ago 
Oh i didn't know that, that is a good idea!

Sa Mo : 15 days ago 
To people who say that this is already a great product and 38dBa is already low etc.,
We know that this product is great, kudos to Philips! What we are saying is that from the very beginning of this campaign we were told that the noise level is around 30dB. We won't give any other value on lumens as this is the reality and this is what is being done in the industry. Thanks

Prabz Hn : 16 days ago 
@Sebastian - You won't be able to derive anything from comparing projectors with ANSI value for DLP-LED technology. Refer to this for better understanding. https://www.colorlightoutput.com/Color_Brightness_Buyers_Guide.pdf

Also join this active Telegram group where we have been discussing this and many other points, for better insights: https://t.me/PicoPixMax

@Philips: Before new tests:
1) what currently is the “White Lumens”?
2)what currently is the “Color Lumens” rating on this projector ?
8804574
Sebastian Kahlcke : 16 days ago 
@Prabz - i think ansi lumen will help a lot, because there are many led projectors out there which have been measured by this method. So we could compare to existing LED-Projectors. These LED projectors have all been measured with the same method the American National Standards Institute provides. LG did it, XGIMI did it, Xiaomi did it, BenQ did it - why not Philips ?
⤷ Philips Projection : 16 days ago 
Hello, again, this is 800. If you buy another projector advertising the same lumens, you will see 800 and the same number of lumens
8804560
Prabz Hn : 16 days ago 
@Alex & @Sebastian: But just ANSI Lumens will not help you. And there is nothing called "ANSI Color Lumens" as well.

ANSI Lumens only talks about "White Brightness". Color Lumens (IDMS Standard) will help measure "Red-Green-Blue Brightness" which is more realistic.

So @Philips - Can you please help separately provide, 1) what currently is the "White Lumens" and 2)what currently is the "Color Lumens" rating on this projector ? (before light engine change)
8804555
Marco Müller : 16 days ago 
@Mathieu jobic: Sorry this is nonsense. Standard Pico Projectors are below 30 dB(A) thus these are used for presentations in small conference rooms. Standard values for non-profi-units are from 30-35 dB(A). But for lamp, Not LED. 

In past three weeks  Philips themselfes stated: „we are aiming below 30 dB(A) and we are near,“ 38 dB(A) is not near. It is three times more, thus dB(A) is measured logarithmical.
⤷ Philips Projection : 16 days ago 
Hello Marco, again, this is an on going job, we are still working on it. We are just giving you the on going status as everyone is asking :-)

8804501
Mathieu jobic : 16 days ago 
@marco muller
32 db is almost silent, either you got super hearing or your projector was broken, get a decibel meter (not a cheap knock off ) and make some mesure, you will be surprise
8804496
Mathieu jobic : 16 days ago 
For those who claim that  38db is a lot, you need to know that residual noise (thats the level you get without any sound at a) is close to 30 db , 65 db is a vacum cleaner, anything under 40 is close to a desktop, between 41 and 47 then we can say it start to be noisy.
Go buy a good decibel meter to be sure. 
And again this is a pico projector, not a 3000 euro projector for a high end home cinema, if its too loud for you, you will need to buy something at a higher price and probably bigger.
⤷ Philips Projection : 16 days ago 
Mathieu, you are right, even a room without any noise is 31dba

It is not about the VAT, it's about the customs clearance cost, the additional fee the shipping company charges you for paying the vat in advance. Often that fee is as much as the VAT itself. You have replied before that you should contact the logistics team of yours and get an answer. As far as I know that question still has not been answered.
⤷ Stig Petersheim : 16 days ago 
For me free shipping is product price + VAT and no additional cost. That's the reason why I ask "is free shipping including the customs clearance cost".

Mehmet N. Tomac : 18 days ago 
Hi. I'm planning to use this projector as a replacement to TV. I don't want my kids to access it easily since I want to follow what they watch. I was wondering if there is a password protection that we can activate or could you please implement some kind of password protection in order to prevent anybody using it without informing me? Great job guys! Thank you.
⤷ Philips Projection : 18 days ago 
Hello There, 
you have 2 options:
- install a parental control with kids content and you can even give access to certain apps and timing: Kidoz app
- install a separate launcher with a parental control (there are many out there)
Cheers

2)Story tab shows 800 ANSI Color Lumens & FAQ tab shows 800 color lumens.Confusing! It can either be 800 ANSI or 800 Color (CLO),can't be both!Refer here www.colorlightoutput.com cross-check with tech team & answer to all of us.It makes a big difference to all of us so pls be true.
ANSI only measures white light output. IDMS-CLO measures color light output.

at 22:23:: 10 569 backers "Only 9 left" (before i buy one)
at 22:39:: 10 570 backers "Only 8 left"
at 22:45:: 10 571 backers "Only 7 left"
at 23:51:: 10,588 backers "Only 8 left"
at 00:13:: 10 594 backers "Only 8 left"
at 00:48:: 10 595 backers "Only 7 left"
at 01:37:: 10 604 backers "Only 7 left"
at 01:45:: 10 605 backers "Only 8 left" (+ "10 days left" message)
at 04:38:: 10 616 backers "Only 8 left"
⤷ Samuel Molteni : 20 days ago 
In this one loop, it rotates between 9 and 7 continuously. (9,8,7 > 9,8,7 > ...)

Is it an Indiegogo tool that offers you to automatically do ca on your campaign to maximize sales by putting pressure on new visitors?

This is very surprising about a crownfunding campaign, we are entitled to wonder if we can trust you?

I’m not criticizing the projector that looks good, but I have doubts about your sharing with Indiegogo and how your campaign works, and I don’t think I’m the only one.

⤷ Massimiliano Comar : 21 days ago

8795888
marvelous.islander : 21 days ago 
@ carljohan selke When import something from another country, you need to pay import duties & taxes, and sometimes, admin fees. In our case, we need to pay extra VAT (which is tax). Technically, things from another EU country do not subject to duties (0-20%); however, it's so rare that the price of the product bought in EU does not contain VAT, so I'm also not sure whether paying duty is required or not. Last but not least, not sure whether there is admin fees in Sweden.
⤷ marvelous.islander : 21 days ago 
Anyway, the last time I bought something from a non-EU country, I need to pay more than 30% of the original price as an extra fee to get my staff. BTW, the shipping company was DHL, but the taxes/duties were handled by Postnord at that time

8795524
Amanda Liggett : 21 days ago 
Does anyone know what size power bank would be needed to charge the projector? Planning to look in to buying one. Very excited for this projector!
⤷ Philips Projection : 21 days ago 
Hey Amanda you have 2 solutions:
- any powerbank will charge the battery
- but you will need a 65watts powerbank to be able to charge and maintain the projector on.
With the solution 1, your powerbank will still charge the PicoPix Max battery, but the built-in battery will power the projector. In the solution 2, the powerbank will charge AND power the projector
⤷ Amanda Liggett : 21 days ago 
Thank you so much! This is very helpful, and thank you for such a quick reply!
⤷ Philips Projection : 21 days ago 
Welcome!

⤷ Alex Sid : 23 days ago 
Which service will you be using then?
⤷ Alex Sid : 23 days ago 
Just to clarify - it it possible to use EMS when shipping to Russia? That's an express service (with tracking, home delivery and everything), but it's regarded as public, hence it has the same limits\fees as regular post (30% fee over 500 euro). Any other express service is 30% fee over 0-200 euro, which is quite substantial.
⤷ Philips Projection : 23 days ago 
hello Alex, ou logistic team will send an email to all backers when everything will be ready.

Jarno Laine : 24 days ago 
I was about to buy 45W 3A powerbank but now you are already talking about 67W charging? Can you please explain to us what is the BEST solution to prolong PicoPix Max ”field” life when you don’t have access to normal household electric current? And by this I mean what would be that USB-C power source with what voltage? How many (W)atts and (A)mpere can this machine take in?
⤷ Philips Projection : 24 days ago 
Hello Jarno
- You can use a powerbank that will charge the internal battery
- the internal battery will continu to deliver enough power to the projector
⤷ Jarno Laine : 24 days ago 
Yes , thank you Philips Projection for quick reply again. But you didn’t answer my question to the point. Power bank as itself is probably the best solution when considering this portable projector but could you be little more specific when we are talking about these universal definitions.
⤷ Jarno Laine : 24 days ago 
As advertised you are talking about maximum of 3 hours battery life with some? brightness. I want to see some of the Lord of the Rings extended versions (any one of them is more than 3 hours in lenght) outdoors. ⤷ Philips Projection : 24 days ago

8791758
Alex : 24 days ago 
Hi! Can I use picopix max with full brightness when using 60W power source since you now say that charging is supported up to 67W? And if I do use only 60W is it charging at all or not? (Going to use this mainly stationary with power source connected)
⤷ Philips Projection : 24 days ago 
Hello, 
Charging can be done with any charger and any voltage as the USB-C will ask the power support to the charger. But if you use a charger that is lower than 67watts, the battery will still charge, slowly and the battery will keep deliver power to the projector. The other solution is to shut down the projector, and charge the battery with any powerbank or charger.

Lockhardo Loverdaal : 24 days ago 
Dear Philips and fellow backers,
You (Philips) stated multiple times that there is no delay when using BT speakers. How is this possible? In my understanding, there is always a delay with BT speakers, even the better codecs like the AptX LL have a (small) delay. What happens if I use older BT speakers like JBL Extreme (BT4.1/SBC)? The latency with these is usually 150 - 225ms and that's not suitable for Netflix etc. If I stereo pair, it gets even worse. Could the OS include a delay compensation?
⤷ Philips Projection : 24 days ago 
Hello, we have tested with old speakers and we don't have this issue at all!
⤷ Lockhardo Loverdaal : 24 days ago

Erman Akkaya : 24 days ago 
Hello,

I just wanted to ask if I can charge or keep it powered up with a regular powerbank?

Fast charge devices for phones that are 2A will be enough? Or are we stuck with the adapter coming with the device?
⤷ Philips Projection : 24 days ago 
Hello Erman, 
With a charger lower than 67watts you have 2 options
- keep the device ON, so the charger will charge the battery and the battery will deliver the power to the PicoPix Max
- switch OFF the device and keep your power adapter or powerbank charging the device.

8790311
Eirik Grønmo Bjørnsen : 25 days ago 
I backed but just watched the videos in the update section. I could clearly notice the PicoPix doing some heavy interlacing happening when Buck Bunny throws an apple and the butterly flies around him. This looks really bad and is also confusing for the eye. This also occurred in the PicoPix promo video shown off where in the womans workout session her hair waves and it appears some purple shapes to fill in for the fast movement. Is this something we will experience with the product after launch?
⤷ Philips Projection : 25 days ago 
Hello, no because this is due to the camera FPS, our agency shot the movie in a certain FPS and we shot our updates in Europe with another FPS. We don't see those interlacing at all in real life and we would not sell a product like this. This would be a big defective batch for us.
⤷ Eirik Grønmo Bjørnsen : 25 days ago

⤷ Gabriel Lins Tenorio : 26 days ago 
I mean, the VAT is 25% and the import tax is 60%. The rest are creditcard and warehouse fees. Therefore, after summing them the final price would be the double when using the courier service. :-(
8788868
Mathieu jobic : 26 days ago 
Those those who ask for security update, this isn't a smartphone, there isn't a sim card with a phone number, and even if you are connected to wifi its a pico projector, you won't check your mail or bank account on it, worst case you get your netflix login stolen, you are not going to shop online either, and when you use it for business, it will be has a projector with a hdmi cable or with mirorecast so chill.

8788826
Lennox Ruiz : 26 days ago 
As another Canadian backer, I'm all for keeping costs down. Pls ship with USPS. This won't be a good deal anymore if we get charged a lot on the back end.
8788780
Johannes The : 26 days ago 
Just wanted to echo other Canadian backers - Courier companies charges crazy additional "brokerage" fees ON TOP of VAT/Tax that we have to pay.  For example, FEDEX charges $50 on top of VAT/Tax (https://www.fedex.com/en-us/shipping/international-ground-canada.html).  
USPS does not charge additional fees and might be cheaper for you to send the package from US to Canada (https://www.stamps.com/whitepapers/how-to-ship-to-canada-with-usps-guide.pdf).  WIN for Philips and WIN for Canadian backers!
8788768
Kristen Schat : 26 days ago

⤷ Philips Projection : 26 days ago 
Hello, the touchpad is not customizable because it contains only the 3 keys for Android and the touchpad it self

Let me echo what some other Canadians have requested: please do NOT use a courier company for delivery to your Canadian supporters, since they typically charge exorbitant fees for their services.  USPS is the much more reasonable shipper to use :)

Thank for the reply! But shooting 4K @60fps does not create motion smoothing that the Netflix show was displaying.

I shot a test with this video I found on YT with my camera in 4K @60fps, and you can still see the difference as you do in the video between the real 24fps version and the motion smoothing version - https://youtu.be/SPZXR4sxfRc

I'm hyped for this product and I want it to be the best, delivering motion options. Look forward to seeing the PicoPix Max projector settings video clip!

Hello, in one of the comments you said that formula for color lumens is as follows: "Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings. So 800."
Can you elaborate? Lumens - so ansi lumens? Vivid color? What does it mean? Picture settings? Are picture settings measured in lumens? 
how much real ansi lumens does picopix output?

8787094
小龍 李 : 28 days ago

8787055
lukesavvides : 28 days ago 
What is the ANSI lumens of this projector? NOT the colour ANSI, the proper ANSI
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
Hello, 800. Cheers!
⤷ lukesavvides : 28 days ago 
No this is 800 colour ANSI lumens which is different to normal ANSI lumens. I want to know what is the normal ANSI lumens?
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
Unfortunately, the rule that ANSI Lumens are a universal measurement of brightness for projectors is simply not the case. ANSI Lumens refers to the measurement of determining the brightness of white pixels and was adapted for lamp based projectors. Current projector technology like LED projectors with RGB-B have better color saturation and appear brighter than lamp based projectors.
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
With the evolution of both the content that we watch and the projectors themselves, standard ANSI Lumens are now obsolete. 
We compared a dozen of projectors advertising 1000 "ANSI LUMENS" and found out that the visible brightness was not the same. A precise measurement shown that the difference between advertised ANSI and the reality was, in some cases more than 54%.
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
We are using the term Color Lumens which better describes how bright the image will actually look. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings. So 800.
⤷ lukesavvides : 28 days ago 
In this case, do you have a figure for the brightness of the white pixels so we can compare to lamp based projectors? It gives a better comparison than 'Color Lumens' because noone else in the industry uses this. Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
Hello, we don't give such data, we only communicate on the Lumens which is the industry standard. 800 lumens would be comparable to 800 lumens.
⤷ lukesavvides : 28 days ago 
OK thanks, I hope it is comparable to 800 ansi lumens of white pixels!!
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
It is!
8787004
Sean Scott : 28 days ago

Mr James Watson : 28 days ago 
Hi, I’m getting quite confused by all the ARC comments being posted. I have a pioneer VSX930 amp that feeds surround sound speakers. I’m hoping to feed my Apple TV box into the amp, via HDMI in, and then HDMI out to the projector; so audio through the surround speakers and visuals through the projector. Is this possible?
This is probably a very basic/naive question, but I’ve never owned a projector before, and after searching about ARC I’m confused! 
Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 28 days ago 
Hello, yes if you use an Apple TV, you can tell the it to send the sound via Optical out to your amp and the video to the Picopix Max

8785311
Tony Petrilli : 29 days ago 
@Michael Ying, PicoPix Max is a projector capable of native 1080p resolution output. "1080p and 4k supported" means that it can accept 1080p and 4k input. As it is a 1080p projector, 4k content will be downscaled to 1080p for projection.

Dennis Wagner : 29 days ago 
@Ajay and @Gabriel
15 hours ago they said “ Great news! We have received the PicoPix Max packaging and we will get some shots tonight along with the video showing Youtube, APTOIDE store and Netflix.”
After doing that it takes time to edit, pass internal reviews, then post.  So it could easily be another day or so to actually see the video.
⤷ Dennis Wagner : 29 days ago 
Or even two or three days.  
This is from decades of product development and engineering experience, and these days with the instant and explosive atmosphere of the internet I’d be careful to shoot video and post to minimise the many dangers of getting inaccurate footage due to shutter angle, frame rate, and scan speed interacting with a video projector picture which is then converted by Indiegogo, YouTube, Facebook to be displayed on a huge range of different mobile phones, tablets, computers.
⤷ Philips Projection : 29 days ago 
Hello Denis, you are totally right.

@Matthew Rose, ARC means "audio return channel", it enables multichannel audio out when you connect a compatible equipment to the HDMI IN port on the projector :)

To all those speaking of "future", don't get your hopes high ;

They never last 30 years, even in big projectors.
They NEVER last long in such small products, mainly because of the heat generated.

8784043
Will Plaister : 29 days ago 
Is ARC a physical change or a protocol? Maybe the pcba already supports arc as it's hdmi 1.4 compliant. Software update perhaps? 
Also, just read somewhere that ARC can't decode HD formats like dts master, dolby HD, dts x or dolby atmos. In this sense, it's the exactly the same as optical which is only capable of the old dolby and dts formats. eArc on the other hand...:P
Some form of digital output aside from BT is good for future-proofing. Who knows how we'll connect picopix in the future!?
8784027
Will Plaister : 29 days ago 
@ Matthew Rose. I've owned a few Yamaha receivers over the journey too, they just don't die! Haha!
So I quickly checked and the RXV367 does support arc so IF they include this feature you'd get 5.1 surround from any source (apple tv, bluray, set top box) and you'd also get 5.1 surround from any app that supports and outputs dts/dolby etc. - Netflix, Plex, Kodi, VLC, sports apps and so on :)

Cheers,
Will
8784007

Hello Lorena, unfortunately a fan is needed to cool down the system. Light produces heat. We are currently investigating into water cooling on our cinema oriented product (Screeneo), but that won't come till 1 or 2 years...
⤷ Lorena Leung : 29 days ago

Daniel Sand : 30 days ago 
many of you are poorly informed about Arc. Firstly, for the extractor audio splitter to work, the output device (projector or tv) must have an arc input. Then it is useless what they are saying.
Secondly If we can reduce the number of cables, welcome be the arc.
we can expect a delay in delivery. do not despair that if these implementations are achieved we will enjoy all of us.

https://www.amazon.com/avedio-links-Extractor-Splitter-Converter/dp/B07H94D77V/ref=sr_1_4?crid=LDNNS4VBT7AQ&keywords=hdmi+audio+splitter&qid=1569411544&s=gateway&sprefix=hdmi+audio%2Caps%2C245&sr=8-4

8783321
Will Plaister : 30 days ago 
@Matthew Rose. I dunno, I personally wouldn't connect directly the bd player to the projector as Philips have recommended below. I would connect your sources (bluray, Apple TV etc.) directly to the Yamaha AVR. Then 'hdmi out' to the projector. Some AVRs have dual hdmi outputs so you could connect 1 to TV and 1 to the picopix max without having to manually change hdmi cables when you switch between tv/projctor. As far as I know the audio delay would be minute. Philips say delay is 30ms on hdmi.
⤷ Will Plaister : 30 days ago 
Also, what's your Yamaha model number?
By connecting all your sources directly to an AVR you ensure IT takes care of the HD audio decoding (5.1/7.1/Atmos etc.) and simply 'passes' the video through to the TV or projector.
Make sense?
8783301
Danny Duong : 30 days ago

Hi, Mayuri! Our earliest perk offerings are greatly discounted from our regular pricing, and we've increased the prices a few times throughout our campaign. As the number of backers our campaign gathers goes up, the price will continue to go up. A larger discount is a perk of being an early supporter! We can assure you it's not an Indiegogo scam. We also encourage you to reach out to us here if you have any other concerns related to your order: hello@picopix.com. Thanks!

8779235
Harry Cheng : 1 month ago 
Hi, does the 85% NTSC refer to as the CIE 1931 color space?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello, Cie1931 is the measurement system for colours. NTSC is one specific triangle of colours where red green and blue points are fixed on the CIE1931 scale. They’re different things. Can you precise the question?
⤷ Harry Cheng : 1 month ago 
Oh it seems I have misunderstood these terms, thanks for clarifying:)

Some people disagree with their assessment of the brightness of the color apparently. For those wondering, the TI chip used is probably this one :
http://www.ti.com/product/DLP3310

If I'm right, it sounds a lot like pixel shifting to me =)
"Pixel array size is 1368 columns by 768 rows in a square grid pixel arrangement. The fast switching speed of the DMD micromirrors combined with advanced DLP image processing algorithms enables each micromirror to display two distinct pixels on the screen during every frame, resulting in a full 1920 x 1080 pixel image being displayed."
⤷ LEGRET Nicolas : 1 month ago

8778256
Philippe Drugmanne : 1 month ago 
Sorry if the question has already been asked, but since you are using a different measure than the units commonly used in the projectors worlds, how much lumens is this projector (i d like to compare it to my 2000 lumen short throw current projector)
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Unfortunately, the rule that ANSI Lumens are a universal measurement of brightness for projectors is simply not the case. ANSI Lumens refers to the measurement of determining the brightness of white pixels and was adapted for lamp based projectors. Current projector technology like LED projectors with RGB-B have better color saturation and appear brighter than lamp based projectors.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
With the evolution of both the content that we watch and the projectors themselves, standard ANSI Lumens are now obsolete. 
We compared a dozen of projectors advertising 1000 "ANSI LUMENS" and found out that the visible brightness was not the same. A precise measurement shown that the difference between advertised ANSI and the reality was, in some cases more than 54%.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
We are using the term Color Lumens which better describes how bright the image will actually look. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings.
8778231
jaysing.wu : 1 month ago 
Taiwan
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello, as soon as you have an issue, you will be able to send us an email or contact our call center. Cheers!

⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago

2: we have 23db on have Screeneo U3, so everything is possible :)
⤷ LEGRET Nicolas : 1 month ago 
Ok, so VAT is lost in case of refund, thanks for clarifying that !

Screeneo U3 is huge compared to picopix max, so it may be possible using a largely wider case ;)
anyway, it's advertised at 25dB and measured by reviewers around 32dB (@ full brightness).
That number seems a lot more realistic, since most room's ambient noise can be measured around 28/30dB ;)
⤷ LEGRET Nicolas : 1 month ago 
Well, I know I won't get realistic values for noise level, brightness, and contrast ratio, this is common practice in the display industry, unfortunately.
We'll need to wait for reviews to see the real numbers, but campaign ends in 15 days and I doubt we'll get independent reviews before that date.

Too bad, just have to take the bet I guess !
Hope you can make it real quieter =)

⤷ Pico Pico : 1 month ago

AY, that's true for calling but not for video shooting.

Igor Panchernikov : 1 month ago 
Will HDR be supported ?

8775199
Thomas Hill : 1 month ago 
In addition to higher perceived brightness, projectors with LED also tend to have higher luminous efficiency, higher perceived light output, wider colour gamut, and stunning image quality. 

Clearly, with the "Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings", this means the standard "ANSI Lumens" may be less than 800, but the overall viewing quality will be better than what you might think of say "600 ANSI Lumens". Why would Philips undersell using an outdated standard.
8775161
Ludovic LE GAL : 1 month ago 
About the discussion "ANSI Lumens" vs "Color Lumens", everybody can have a look at this page (from Viewsonic, a competitor of Philips ;-) ) which explains very well the difference of perception you have with a DLP projector :
https://www.viewsonic.com/de/products/projectors/lumens/
Instead of "Color Lumens", they use the term of "LCD Lumens", but it's the very same discussion.
It gives keys to understand the subject and (maybe ?) close the topic...
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Ludovic, each and every brand has its own way. We do not rely on our competition and the statement we made several time here is pretty straight forward :)
⤷ Ludovic LE GAL : 1 month ago 
I understand why you say you don't rely on competitors...
Nevertheless, for those who need a visual explanation, the view "Same measured brightness" / "Same perceived brightness" and, more, the parallel pictures of 2200 ANSI Lumens lamp projector and 900 ANSI Lumens LED projector are very pertinent to explain what you mean when you say "Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings".
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Ludovic, if you buy a projector at 800 ansi lumens, our PicoPix Max will have the same brightness. So 800

8775109
Mika Myllyvaara : 1 month ago 
Can you post pics of projector menus? Settings etc. Would be interesting.
8775105
Riku Verkkomäki : 1 month ago 
I´m not happy what you answer to Alex S and I repeat question nr 2: 2. What is the closest : regular“ANSI lumens” equivalent of 800 “ANSI color”lumens you quote for this device?
“Color lumen” is some new term you introduce which is different metric from “industry standard”, which is ‘ANSI lumens’. ‘ANSI lumens’ is metric quoted by most manufacturers including Texas Instruments, who provide chips for the whole industry.

Answer to question nr. 1 are perhaps 45w ??
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello Riku, Unfortunately, the rule that ANSI Lumens are a universal measurement of brightness for projectors is simply not the case. ANSI Lumens refers to the measurement of determining the brightness of white pixels and was adapted for lamp based projectors. Current projector technology like LED projectors with RGB-B have better color saturation and appear brighter than lamp based projectors.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
With the evolution of both the content that we watch and the projectors themselves, standard ANSI Lumens are now obsolete. 
We compared a dozen of projectors advertising 1000 "ANSI LUMENS" and found out that the visible brightness was not the same. A precise measurement shown that the difference between advertised ANSI and the reality was, in some cases more than 54%.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
We are using the term Color Lumens which better describes how bright the image will actually look. Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings
⤷ Riku Verkkomäki : 1 month ago 
Dear Philips, If there are no comparable numerical values, we would love to see the video in different conditions (bright light and dim lights) as well as products with comparable brightness, such as to the XGIMI Z6 Polar. And yes, yes I know the product is not comparable, but we know how bright it is and that is what interests us. Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello Riku,
We already sent videos and will post a new one today on facebook but we will never compare to our competitors.
8775011
Emil R : 1 month ago 
Hi,

Is this capable of installing and handling graphic heavy android games?

Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello Emil, the PicoPix Max is made for gaming but doesn't replace a gaming console. That's why we are now working with a French cloud gaming to avoid using the internal CPU. We tested it with Asphalt racing and it's running smoothly
⤷ Emil R : 1 month ago 
Hi,

In short, you are not recommending to install high graphics game on the PicopixMax?
I'm planning on using this device on the indoor cycling app "Zwift".

I want to know if this app will be able to run directly on your device without issues or would it be better to run it on my phone and cast/connect it to picopixmax(and have some lag).

Thank you
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago

8773842
Oliver : 1 month ago 
@Seyedamirhosein Motamedi: I'm afraid those 14-days withdrawal rights only apply if an EU customer buys from an EU seller. But in this case, the seller is not in the EU. You don't get such a withdrawal right when you buy from Aliexpress either, for example. This has nothing to do with VAT.
VAT is collected by the delivery service and transferred to the fiscal authorities of the country where you live; Philips has nothing to do with this at all.

Would like to know more about the software part of the device. 
1. Is that possible to include the chromecast-like casting features?  
    i. cast video content to the device, e.g. youtube / netflix
    ii. cast chrome browser
2. How is the app store works on the device? For us to further download apps?
3. How do the device do future firmware upgrades? Like upgrade to newer versions of Android?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Mickeo, 
1: chromecast feature will come in a future update
2: you can already do screen mirroring with Android or Airplay
3: APTOIDE worls exactly like the PLaystore but it will show only apps that are compatible for landscape display like a projector
4: FOTA updated via Wi-Fi but we won't upgrade to Android 10 or 11 as there is not point to get such feature on a projector. Between Android 6 or 10, you won't see the difference as we have our own launcher.
Cheers!

Franck Rosenstein : 1 month ago

8772108
carljohan selke : 1 month ago 
So how did Philips come up whit 800 color lumens  how did Philip's measure this ?if its cant be converted into other lumens value
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello, we have already closed this topic :-).
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Unfortunately, the rule that ANSI Lumens are a universal measurement of brightness for projectors is simply not the case. ANSI Lumens refers to the measurement of determining the brightness of white pixels and was adapted for lamp based projectors. Current projector technology like LED projectors with RGB-B have better color saturation and appear brighter than lamp based projectors.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
With the evolution of both the content that we watch and the projectors themselves, standard ANSI Lumens are now obsolete. 
We compared a dozen of projectors advertising 1000 "ANSI LUMENS" and found out that the visible brightness was not the same. A precise measurement shown that the difference between advertised ANSI and the reality was, in some cases more than 54%. We are using the term Color Lumens which better describes how bright the image will actually look.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Essentially, Color Lumens = Lumens + Vivid Color + Fine Tuned Picture Settings."
8772092
Ludovic LE GAL : 1 month ago 
@Philips & @El Medhi Asselman :
We will see after Philips' measuring, but for me the best response is that the size of the image is not 250" but 150", which needs to be displayed the exact distance you announced : 4 meters (157,5" with the 1.05 ratio).
For a 250" image in 16:9, you need a wall 3,55m high and 6,35m wide ...
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Ludovic, thanks for pointing out this error, it's indeed 261" distance from the wall to get 250" diagonal display. We were so excited to show this massive image that we didnt realize the distance. In any case, we do not recommend to get this big size but to stay under 120" to get the best contrast and colors. Thanks!
⤷ Ludovic LE GAL : 1 month ago 
No problem, guys ;-)
But you should update the Update #4, which mentions this false size.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Ludovic, the size is fine, 250" is ok. We didn't talk about the distance to the wall

⤷ Ludovic LE GAL : 1 month ago 
Hum... I do not understand the reasoning. We see on your infographic that we get an image of 80" at a projection distance of 84", 100" at 105" and 120" at 126". So we have a factor of 1.05 between the size of the image and the distance of projection. So, as the zoom does not go beyond 100% (i.e. it can't upscale the image), for the 250" we should be at 262", or 6.65m... By this calculation, at 3.5m the image would be 3.33m, that is to say 131".
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Ludovic this is not how you calculate. There is an equation between the throw ratio, the brightness, the diagonal size... So we will measure again tonight about those 250" to be sure

Joao Manoel Barbosa Pereira : 1 month ago 
Hi, is the USB-c video input capable to deliver power to a connected device? My computer have a USB-C port that is the same used to charge it. If yes how many watts can a device take from the USB-c port while sending data?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Joao, there is 1 type C for power and 1 for video. the projector is really powerful and needs 45watts. Cheers!
⤷ Joao Manoel Barbosa Pereira : 1 month ago 
How powerful is the charger that is included? I asked if I can use the projector using the charger and still charge my device that will be connected to the USB-c video port, even if a little. My phone only have a USB-C port for charging, and to output video, so I cannot charge it when using the connector for video output. How many amps I can drain from the USB-C video connector while using the projector? 5V@2A????
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
You will need 45 watts. and the USB-C video cannot deliver power. You will need 1 charger for your device and 1 for the projector. Otherwise if your device has 2 USB-C, you can charge the PicoPix Max with your device but you device needs to be connected to a power adapter.
⤷ Joao Manoel Barbosa Pereira : 1 month ago 
ok Philips thank you for your reply. In the specification of the projector is mentioned that the projector has a powerbank function, so this would be only in the type A USB connector, I suspect. Can I drain 5V@2A from there and still use the projector? I think maybe you could rewrite the sentence on the page "The USB Type-C ports deliver fast data, audio, video and quick charging!" to not confuse the reader, since the USB-C cannot charge the user device.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello Joao the sentence is clear, the USB-C are used for Videos, audio, and charging. The USB-A can be used as a powerbank yes.

8769994
Oliver : 1 month ago 
I'm a little confused. I just read through the “Story” page again, and the section about automatic horizontal keystone correction shows a photo of a projector that's positioned _sideways_. Is this what _horizontal_ keystone means? Most other projectors have keystone correction for when the image is projected upwards or downwards, but not sideways. Please clarify.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello Oliver
Yes indeed! We have correction up down but also left right. With the 4 corners correction, you can project a straight image even if the projector is not in front of the wall!
⤷ Oliver : 1 month ago 
Thanks, but that does NOT answer my question. I mean the automatic horizontal keystone correction that you are advertising – Is that for sideways projection, or is that for projection upwards / downwards?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Automatic is for up down and the 4 corners correction is manual for a better precision
⤷ Oliver : 1 month ago 
Thanks. That's the answer I was hoping for. You might want to correct the photo and/or accompanying description on the “Story” page because it's misleading (or ambiguous, at the very least).

You say it's also for gaming. Isn't 30ms lag a little too much for gaming?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago

Hi @Phillips,

For shipping to Canada from the U.S. you mentioned maybe using DHL, as noted by James C and Johannes The, couriers like UPS and DHL are the worst when it comes to the brokerage fees that they add on top of any customs charges. FedEx is only slightly better.

I would also like to vote for USA->Canada shipping to use express shipping via US Post (which will then transfer Canada Post).

Thanks very much for update 4, really looking forward to my PicoPix Max!!

In update 4 you show some pictures of it projecting at 250". I know you advertise the product as maximum 120", on bigger sizes the image quality will degrade and that is perfectly understandable. So let me repeat the pros and cons :
Pros:
1080p pico projector.
800 COLOR lumens (lumens you just created and can't compare to others btw).

Cons:
-Bad speakers (too weak to watch a movie in good conditions...think about it: eyes at 1080p, ears at 2x4w? So an external bluetooth speaker becomes mandatory).
-Fan noise (?)
-No way to cast content AND do multitasking for chrome/android users (that's smart tv from 2014).

Also, 3hours battery life was for 600 lumens, how much with 800 lumens?
Thks

8762488
Pedro Sá Borges : 1 month ago 
Hello, i have just one sugestion about HDMI capabilities. Being 1.4 version, is there a chance you could implement ARC at least? I know it's a portable projector but this would really be a plus to be able to play netflix with real 5.1 surround sound.
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello Pedro, unfortunately ARC is based on hardware and we closed the PCBA modifications. Cheers!
⤷ Pedro Sá Borges : 1 month ago 
Sorry but i don't understand. Why is there a hardware limitation when there is already HDMI 1.4 available? Isn't this all you need to have ARC?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Pedro, even if you have 1.4, you need a special chip to decode the Audio and send it back to HDMI.

8762148
Amar Soman : 1 month ago 
Hello, suppose a Blutooth audio lag is experienced for some reason on external speakers when watching Netflix, is there a function to sync audio and video?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Amar, not right now, but our aim is that there will not be any lag during video playback, the user won't need to control this. aptX is not required to reduce latency during video playback. aptX is only needed for low latency for live audio like games or music apps. Prerecorded content will always be auto-compensated

8762089
Anton A. : 1 month ago 
Regarding fan/cooler control optimization. Speed must change gradually! Not like 20%->90%, it's really epic fail and annoying. If you set high temperature threshould, fan will start on 100%. Also bad. To make it quiter fan construction is - the blades are placed very close to each other, fan is wide but thin. Something like server fan construction for U1 servers. Good luck! :)
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Anton, yes you are totally right and this is what we are looking for. Cheers!

H B : 2 months ago 
You say we can't use it as a bluetooth speaker only, because it is a projector. But the Capsule II is a projector and offers this feature. I see no hardware limitation that would prevent using this as a bluetooth speaker?
⤷ Philips Projection : 1 month ago 
Hello HB. Yes there is a hardware limitation for Bluetooth function in standby mode. This is another BT module that needs to be on even if the projector is off. We can for sure have the projector turned on without the engine to be on. Maybe we can implement this in the future. Cheers

8760624
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
4. Interoperability between devices: Most of the projectors support wireless streaming or casting from the device to the projector. However the wireless streaming option would mostly be for Windows device or Android device, and would require an additional device such as Apple TV or Airplay to be connected to the projector in order to stream/cast content from apple devices such as iPhones, Macbooks, Etc. Does this projecto have an inbuilt facility to do airplay without the need for any additions.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello there! yes we have already Airplay built in!
8760623
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
3. Clashing of the Bluetooth output with Video streaming: Most of the time when a video is being streamed from a device to the projector wireless (Windows Wireless Projection, Android Cast, Etc) and the device is connected to a Bluetooth device for audio output. 99.9% of the times the device struggles to stream the video and would be unable to manage both the Bluetooth audio and the wireless video streaming in parallel. How does PicoPix Max address this issue?
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
We never had this issue :-)
8760622
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
2. Sometimes the video being played will have a poor audio quality or would not be audible enough. While we do have video players like VLC which solves such problems by increasing the volume upto 200%. And sometime we have sound driver/ firmware which has the feature of increasing the playback volume to 200%. Would PicoPix Max have such an option to amplify the volume to 200% or more which would be a life saver for many.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Volc is built in and you can even connect to bigger speakers via jack 3.5 or BT.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
VLC
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 1 month ago 
Whether with the Native volume control, the volume can be amplified to 200% using the supplied remote control. It does not matter what app that we use (youtube, amazon prime, netflix) or some other video player. If the volume of the video is low, can it be amplified to 200%. I feel this would be a great feature, since I faced this issues multiple times in the past and I had the only option to connect the projector to a laptop and then play the video on VLC and then increase the volume to 200%.
8760621
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
1. The lens gets scratched over a period of time: This happens while cleaning the lens and despite taking good care caution. Sometimes even a cloud of moisture forms inside the lens which is really hard to clean. All of this will affect the projection quality and will project an image which is not as clear as when the projector was newly purchased. How will PicoPix Max address this issue? Is there a scratch proof glass or lens that covers the actual lens as a protective layer?
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
We never had such issues in our past projectors, especially that our lens is inside the projector. If you face such issue within 2 years, we will take care this :-)
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 1 month ago 
I guess this does not answer my question, Its better to put a protective layer or scratch resistance on the lens or the outer glass protecting the lens. This way we can be confident and relieved that the lens or the outer glass will not be scratched. I am sure you are giving a 2 year warranty and such things will be taken care. However its ideal to prevent than to cure is it?
8760592
Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
I just joined as a backer to this campaign by getting a perk. However I have faced the following practical issues while using projects so far in my experience...
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
1. The lens gets scratched over a period of time: This happens while cleaning the lens and despite taking good care caution. Sometimes even a cloud of moisture forms inside the lens which is really hard to clean. All of this will affect the projection quality and will project an image which is not as clear as when the projector was newly purchased. How will PicoPix Max address this issue? Is there a scratch proof glass or lens that covers the actual lens as a protective layer?
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
2. Sometimes the video being played will have a poor audio quality or would not be audible enough. While we do have video players like VLC which solves such problems by increasing the volume upto 200%. And sometime we have sound driver/ firmware which has the feature of increasing the playback volume to 200%. Would PicoPix Max have such an option to amplify the volume to 200% or more which would be a life saver for many.
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
3. Clashing of the Bluetooth output with Video streaming: Most of the time when a video is being streamed from a device to the projector wireless (Windows Wireless Projection, Android Cast, Etc) and the device is connected to a Bluetooth device for audio output. 99.9% of the times the device struggles to stream the video and would be unable to manage both the Bluetooth audio and the wireless video streaming in parallel. How does PicoPix Max address this issue?
⤷ Aravind Chandrasekaran : 2 months ago 
4. Interoperability between devices: Most of the projectors support wireless streaming or casting from the device to the projector. However the wireless streaming option would mostly be for Windows device or Android device, and would require an additional device such as Apple TV or Airplay to be connected to the projector in order to stream/cast content from apple devices such as iPhones, Macbooks, Etc. Does this projecto have an inbuilt facility to do airplay without the need for any additions.
8760447
Ore Dagan : 2 months ago

⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago

Robin Boh : 2 months ago 
Let's face it guys. It's Philips. 
The answers are always the same. 
Not sure if I have the full list. 
1. No plans for stretch goals / perks.
2. No changes to hardware, just minor improvements to fan noise, what else? 
3.No Android TV since this is custom Android OS. So dont think of built in Chromecast. 
4.Want extra space? Use MicroSD card instead.
5.Want better casing? Sorry. It means adding more costs.
6. How is 800 ANSI color lumens compared with the rest? We are all waiting for reviews.
⤷ Robin Boh : 2 months ago 
Note: For the amount of money they have collected, it will be easier for them to reward the backers. But it is not happening here
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello Robin, I remind you that the amount of money is due to the fact that 5214 backers joined us. The margin are very low and we offer the shipping.
We changed already the hardware by adding BT5, battery bypass, Widevine L1... 
Concerning Android TV, we explained since the beginning that Android TV is now our priority as many backers prefer to get Android OS. Furthermore, we need a special hardware for Android TV. 
Extra Space on ROM means bigger price, and extra tax in Europe
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Casing: yes it's a cost, if you go to a restaurant and ask extra topping on your pizza you will need to pay for it. As the discount is already very high, we don't have space to add more things. We really want to get the best for you but at one point it is not feasible. 
Concerning the 800 lumens, reviews will come as soon as we ship the samples to the Press. 
Hope this is clear, don't hesitate to come back to us if you have any other questions. Have a great day!
⤷ Robin Boh : 2 months ago 
I suggest that for better crowd funding communication and transparency as a company, do update the progress instead of replying every backer. 
So we don't need to see the same everytime.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello Robin, we already launched an update several days ago with those info. Regards
8758702
Sa Mo : 2 months ago 
I've been following the comments and your answers for a few days, and it seems that you are pretty confident about everything but one. You say that your color ansi lumens was calculated differently than other projectors, but you still compare yours with them. So what is the truth here? Is your brightness measure comparable with others? If yes, why you named it differently? If no, then how to convert it in a way that it gets comparable with other projectors in the market. Thanks!
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello Seyedamirhosein.
I think the answer is clear: 1000 lumens on A brand is different from 1000 lumens on B brand. If you buy 2 different product advertising the same lumens, you will see a big difference of brightness. So in order for our customer to get the idea of the amount of lumens, we measured our PicoPix Max and compared with other devices. If we compare to our PicoPix Pro, its much more bright and if we compare to other devices advertising 800 lumens, we are on the same level. Cheers!
⤷ Sa Mo : 2 months ago 
Thanks for the answer! Understand it now. I'm now heading to IFA to visit you and give the projector a look.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello there! I'm not in the booth today with the right proto, I will arrive only tonight but my colleagues are their to welcome you. The proto you will see is 2 months old and doesn't really work. It's just to show the size and features

⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello Jan, yes we will check this internally. Concerning the demo, we will try to show it to you guys but you need to know that for the moment only 3 LEDs are working, not 4 so the brightness wont be 100%. We are still testing and aligning colors/contrast and brightness.

8757116
David Duplantier : 2 months ago 
Hi,
Can I connect a Beoplay A1 via usb-c? If so will the internal DAC of the Beoplay by-pass the PicoPix one?
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello David, no, our USB C is only for video and audio In. Best regards
⤷ David Duplantier : 2 months ago 
Ok. What kind of DAC is used for the jack output? How powerful is it? As BT has big issues with latency what is the best solution to connect external speakers?
Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
David, the DAC used is the one inside the cpu. We are working with the Bluetooth module in order to get the best sync as possible. The best way is for sure jack to another Amp for eg.

Hello Longy, We designed the PicoPix Max to be a portable projector without any very big wire connections. It is supposed to be standalone. 8755979
Brendon McCarthy : 2 months ago 
With the "official" news on Widevine, will all Widevine apps like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, HBO, Disney, etc. be supported? Will any of these be "native" apps installed by default? Aptoide app store support is mentioned, but assuming any app store can be sideloaded, including Google Play? Finally, could Android TV be sideloaded via the APKs and run on top of the custom Android (I know its not for everyone but I like it)?
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello Brendon, we don't know if Disney or the new apps will be compatible as they are not out here. We will test in the future but they won't be pré installed. A lot of apps are country sensitive and we cannot load all of them. You will be able to load it from the store or direct apk. More over you cannot install android TV as it requires a special cpu and is like a new operating system. Like trying to install MacOs on a Pc. Cheers!
⤷ Brendon McCarthy : 2 months ago 
Thanks for the reply. Amazon Prime, Hulu, Disney, HBO all have current apps that could be tested before launch to confirm compatibility :) For app stores, Google Play (https://www.apkmirror.com/apk/google-inc/google-play-store/) could also be tested? Or any of the more secure third-party stores like F-Droid, APKPure. RE: Android TV, the concern is if apps will be TV friendly, Android TV apps are designed for TV (e.g. https://www.apkmirror.com/apk/google-inc/youtube-for-android-tv-android-tv/).

David Liew : 2 months ago 
I’m assuming the HDMI 1.4 is ARC compliant? Does that mean if I feed the PicoPix Max through HDMI ARC through a proper AV receiver system it will bypass its own internal speakers and output audio signal e.g. native DTS/Atmos/etc processed by the AV system to our own home theatre speakers?
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello David, for the moment we don't have ARC as our PicoPix Max is supposed to be a portable projector. Have a good day!
8755513
Will Plaister : 2 months ago 
Hi Philips,
Will there be a menu option to switch off the speaker function? For example, if I have the sound through my home theater system, I will not need 2x4w speakers playing simultaneously.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Will, 
If you pair your home theatre system through Bluetooth, the sound will be forwarded to your system. Cheers!
8755433
H B : 2 months ago 
Hi, you said you tested the Capsule II in front of your product. You said your product is almost 4 times brighter, which is good. I'd be interested to hear the results of the speakers comparaison? Also, how the fans noise compare? Cheers
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
HB, in terms of speakers, as our engine and battery are bigger, our speakers are a little bit less powerful compared to Nebula. On there side, they almost have 70% of the unit for sound, but we decided to get a bigger battery and brighter engine and Full HD DMD. We are currently fine tuning the sound.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
In terms of fan noise, as our engine is 4 times more bright and bigger, the fan will run a bit higher than them.
⤷ H B : 2 months ago 
Hey, thanks for these honest answers. That is what I thought and that's why I since the begining of the campaign I asked if some hardware upgrade on the speakers (to cover fan noise and deliver a proper all-in-one experience) would be possible. Any update on that part? Thanks
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Hello HB, the fan noise is totally covered by the speakers. Even if we have smaller speakers than some of our competitors, they sound great. No we have no space to implement bigger speakers.
⤷ H B : 2 months ago 
I hope it is covered haha, but I meant at lower volume because sometimes you dont want to push volume at max level. I tried the 5w speaker on the Capsule I and it was pretty much trash, that's why I'm concerned about those 2 x 4w tiny speakers (the Capsule 2 8w speaker is actually good (deep and loud)).
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
HB, it's just a question of space. Bigger speaker, bigger power, need bigger space. Adding the same speakers used on the Nebula would increase the size of our projector by at least 4cm high...
⤷ H B : 2 months ago 
Maybe something not as big, but like a middle ground, is there a big difference in terms of space for 5 or 6 watts speakers that would contribute to offer a better experience?
8755376

8755183
Jens : 2 months ago 
For all the backers questioning the lumens/ansi value: it's complicated.

https://www.viewsonic.com/de/products/projectors/lumens/
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Jens, you are totally right. And even 2 projectors taken from the competition, advertising the same lumens, will have a totally different perceived brightness.
8755178

8754975
Gabriel Cescutti : 2 months ago 
Same question here. 
What’s the brightness spec in standardized lumens ? 
Thank you
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Gabriel: there is no standard anymore. The 800 Lumens has been calculated by our engineers and also compared to many brands selling their device at 800 Lumens. We also compared some other brand advertising 1000 but our projector had the same brightness.
8754943
Xiaolan Wang : 2 months ago 
Just as many other people, I would like to have a directly quantifiable number of brightness, not including the other technologies or other extra enhancement. I believe that your technology can give us a better image that feels brighter but I would like to know the exact ANSI lumen number for the projector. Everyone will of course take consideration of the "extra bits" that makes it feel more vivid. It is very risky that you keep advertising it as 800 "nonstandard" lumens.
⤷ Xiaolan Wang : 2 months ago 
Otherwise I would like to know exactly how the number 800 is calculated from you color lumens, specifically so we can calculate the color lumen of their projectors using your standard in order to compare.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Xiaolan, Thank you for your answer. The 800 Lumens has been calculated by our engineers and also compared to many brands selling their device at 800 Lumens. We also compared some other brand advertising 1000 but our projector had the same brightness.
⤷ Xiaolan Wang : 2 months ago 
Would you kindly let us know which devices you compared have the exact same brightness? and how you calculated it?

8754894
Jarno Laine : 2 months ago 
Hello and thank you for this campaign!

There has been already a lot of talk about how you can power and charge your PicoPix Max with a 45W power bank - which is a great feature!

Question I have in mind is that have you tested out any specific (name&brand) 45 W power bank(s) that can power and (underlining) CHARGE PicoPix Max? And you must know that there are loads of different kind of power banks to choose from that CLAIM to have 45 W charging...which might not be true at all.
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Jarno, we have tested Swiss Mobility and Alcatel for the moment which are enough powerful to charge the battery.

⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago 
Mika, 
Even without comparing us to this competitor, we can already tell you that we are more bright because they use an old TI DMD which is only 120 ANSI, enhanced to 200 and only 720p. More Over, we just tested the Nebula Capsule 2 now in front of our PicoPix Max: 1: the throw ratio is higher on Capsule, meaning their image is far smaller than our with the same wall distance. In terms or brightness, this has nothing to do, closed to 4 times higher

⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 2 months ago 
Calculation details :
Item cost : 34000

Shipment cost : 0

Insurance cost : 0

CIF value (item cost + shipment cost + insurance cost) : 34000

Customs duty rate : 10%

CUSTOMS DUTY (customs duty rate * (CIF)) : 3400

Vat rate : 18%

VAT (vat rate * (Customs duty+CIF+other taxes if applicable)) : 6732

Total amount to be paid : 50143.2(excluding extra taxes if applicable)

It comes around US 700$
⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 2 months ago 
Product details :
Product description : Projector

Category : Cameras, Audio & Video

Sub Category : Tv-Home-Theatre-Projectors

Item name : Projector

Hs code : 85-28-69-0-0
Extra taxes details :
LANDING CHARGE IS : 340

CEX IS : 1020

COUNTERVAILING DUTY CESS IS : 4420

ADDITIONAL CVD IS : 231.2

CIF Countervailing Duty of 0 or 448.8 applicable on certain goods
⤷ Rahul Bandekar : 2 months ago

8751468
Mathieu jobic : 2 months ago 
In some comment you are talking about the paint you use for a mirror effect, please eon't do that has shiny glossy paint use to show scratch, finger print and other, why not a mat paint ? It would also diminish all the reflection coming on the pico, reflection paint become a bit of a light parasit if you have to much reflection, the paint need to absorb the light not reflecting it
⤷ Philips Projection : 2 months ago
